intro: Ditroche furcata, commonly known as the forked leaf plant, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its distinctive bifurcated leaves, which give it its common name. It produces small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has some traditional medicinal uses.
